titleStmt.title: A Most straunge and wounderfull accident happened at Weersburch by Franckford, by a most fearefull earthquake and daknesse [sic], with a mighty tempest of thunder and lightning also a most dreadfull embassage vttered to the governour of that Cittie, by three straunge children which were found in a wood, threatning destruction to that countrie, and to all christendome /
titleStmt.author: T. C.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by William Barley, and are to bee sold at his shop in Gracious streete,

notesStmt.note: Illustration consists of two copies of the same plate.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University Library.
